Reviews.Title: Amazing Value
Reviews.Author: R Pen
Reviews.Content: This is the first LCD TV I've bought so I did a tone of research before finally settling on this unit.Things I love about this TV:-The backlight on this thing turns way up so you don't have to worry about having dark scenes like in Interview with the vampire you can't see. The wide viewing angle is also great.-On the quick menu you can easily change the sound between Music and Cinema and I can actually hear the difference. Yes they are tv speakers not surround sound but for my studio apartment it is more then adequate.-I noticed I was getting a little noise on the sound when I had the Clear Voice on but totally fixed it when I put the Auto Volume option on in the audio main menu.-I keep the tv on a lot for music during the day since I work from home and there is this great button on the remote labeled energy where you can quickly adjust from 100% which is the best for viewing to maximum energy saving. I like this not only for the energy savings but also to save the back light from 100% constant use.-I noticed that one of my shows off of my Roku (digital box that streams netflix) wasn't HD and the picture wasn't looking to hot. I adjusted on the picture main menu the aspect ratio to Just Scan and it actually cleaned it up really nicely. This is important,several of my friends have really ritzy tv set ups but if it's not HD the picture is almost unbearable. This one you can watch older movies/tv shows and HD without having to fiddle with everything to get a good picture.-Overall picture quality can be adjusted by so many advanced options that if you play with it I'm sure you can get exactly what you want.-I know it is 720 versus 1080 but at this price range when I looked at the specs if you go for 1080 it seems that you will get dark spots in dark scenes and it's refresh rate will be so low that you will notice it in quick scenes plus the audio seemed unreliable. I think at this 32inch size 720 is really not that noticeable.Very satisfied customer. Only complaint is you need 4 screws to attach the tv to it's base and my baggy only came with 3 in it.  Luckily the hardware store is right down the street so I was able to get something comparable instead of waiting for them to ship it.Do your self a favor, get some good HDMI cables with noise reduction that can handle full HD (found some on amazon for like $7). I haven't experienced any blurring at all on this tv while watching movies/shows like others have commented about. Regular cables don't cut it and you won't want to wait when your tv arrives.Happy Viewing

Reviews.Title: Simply Awesome!
Reviews.Author: papamac67
Reviews.Content: I have been waiting patiently for a few years now to make the switch from my 480i Toshiba 32" CRT to an HDTV. Thanks to  a decent tax return I was finally able to join the Hi Def club. I live in a small apartment and already had a nice entertainment center which housed my aging Toshiba so I chose to stay with the 32" screen format as anything larger would not fit. After doing weeks of research it came down to this LG or the Samsung LN32C350. I found the picture quality to be almost identical and the price was the same for both, $399.00. I chose the LG because I got 10% off with a online coupon and no tax and free shipping from another online retailer. I couldn't be happier! This is one of the best purchases I have ever made. The TV is fantastic!, picture is bright, sharp, clear and gorgeous. The contrast ratio listed here is wrong though...it's not 50,000:1...it's actually 70,000:1...which is even better. I love the remote, easy to use menu and all the functions and options you can tweak. it's such an unbelievable difference seeing TV shows and movies in Hi Def. I can't comment on the sound as I have the TV speakers turned off because I have a pretty kick-ass surround sound system. I am A Dish Network subscriber and have it hooked to my VIP612 receiver and am loving it...also finally able to play my Xbox 360 in Hi Def and that is Da Bomb too!...BF:BC2 looks amazing! I was debating whether to get a 1080p or a 720p TV for a long time...then I found out (which I didn't realise) all HD TV signals...OTA (over the air), DirecTv, Cable, Dish Network are all broadcast in 720p/1080i...and since I don't watch blu-ray movies...spending extra money on a 1080p set just wouldn't make sense...also...on a TV 32" or less..the benefits of watching in 1080p are negligible. 720p looks phenomenal! It has a 1 year parts and labor warranty, and after you register it with LG you can extend your warranty by 2 years for $48...provided you do it in the 1st 180 days after purchase, so altogether you get a 3 year warranty for $48...from the manufacturer...not some 3rd party outfit, that's pretty good...I'll be doing that b4 my 180 days are up. I can't recommend this TV more...I am now an LG fanboy.

Reviews.Title: Worth a buy for the price.
Reviews.Author: N. Mehta
Reviews.Content: *** See posts from U. Viveros (Aug 8th) for info on the panel display on this tv***Picture quality on this tv is excellent (it has an IPS panel), black levels are impressive, color is vibrant. And you can tweak the picture to your likeing with a ton of various options. Took me a while to get the picture quality just right for gaming, HD content and SD content. SD tv actually looks pretty good on this tv, suprisingly sharp picture quality on it. Though this being a LCD tv the picture isn't crystal clear, in darker areas you can see some obvious blurring or trailing (but only if you really want to notice, and its not as bad as the latest Samsung), in brighter areas blurring is not noticeable at all (in Modern Warfare 2 for example darker wood textures you can see the blur when moving, on brighter wall textures there is no blur).Speakers are decent, not going to blow you away with the sound but they aren't complete crap either. Like the picture - sound also has various tweaking options.Remote is pretty standard, doesn't look cheap and doesn't go overboard with the options. But is has everything you'd accept to be on it.Also has a headphone jack (and unlike Samsungs you can control the volume of the headphone jack with your remote).You can also display pictures or play music with a usb stick, I don't think I'll be using this feature. Would've been nice if it allowed you to play videos from the usb stick...but they only have that feature on their higher end models.One problem is that if you switch the input to hdmi and then go back to AV or TV input...there is no sound. You have the turn off the tv and turn is back again to get the sound back.4/5.I paid $[...], amazon now dropped the price.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: This was my father's day present, and I was so excited. We researched 32-inch TVs a lot, and this one seemed like the best for the price. Man, what a lemon. And LG customer service has been really disappointing. The picture went black five weeks after we bought it - just a few days after the 30-day warranty from Future Shop. Future Shop wouldn't give us an exchange, and LG said we had to take it to a repair shop. The nearest one is a 40-minute drive from our house. It was in the shop a month.A couple of months later, the picture stopped working again. LG still won't replace it. So that means another three hours of driving to drop off and return to pick up the TV. The repair shop says LG policy is they won't replace it until after three breakdowns. I could just see that happening a day after the one-year warranty.

Reviews.Title: Great bedroom TV for the money!
Reviews.Author: M. Tomlinson
Reviews.Content: I just bought this TV to replace a 5 year old LCD TV I previously had in my bedroom. For the money, this is a great TV even with the lower contrast ratio compared to more expensive models. I typically buy Samsung LCD and LED TVs but the low price of this LG tempted me to try something new and so far I have no regrets. Other reviewers have done a great job at highlighting what is great about the TV so I am not going to repeat what they have already said.I did, however, want to make a quick mention of the resolution. LG says that this TV is only 720p but my PS3 detected it as supporting 1080p. I've heard of people being able to force certain 720p TVs to do 1080p and it appears that this TV is perhaps one of them. I did play a couple of my PS3 games that are in 1080p and the TV did, in fact, run in 1080p looking great so... take that for what its worth.For a TV that can be had for under $400, this is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Stunning Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Shekhar
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV couple of months ago from Walmart. What a stunning picture quality it has. It stood out from all the TVs on display around it due to it's vivid color and crisp picture. We bought it immediately and no regret. We love the picture quality. Sound quality is average as they say how it is in the flat TVs. Hence I bought a home theater system to complement it's picture quality and now we have stunning picture with amazing sound. Watching TV/movies is more fun than ever. With the home theater system, the sound is now balanced and there is no shocking sound level increase during the commercials.The remote is nice and I like the quick setup button which pops up a circular dialogue box on the TV with most frequently used settings.It has two HDMI inputs altough some competition TVs have more than 2 HDMI inputs. It also features a digital optical audio out and number of other traditional connectors including VGA input so that you could use it as a monitor for your computer.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Great Price
Reviews.Author: Jason C. Torres "JT"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a TV for my master bedroom for about $400.  This was by far the best tv for the price and value.  Rich picture, great sound and awesome black levels.  Not an 1080?  Yea, you can't notice a difference with a 32" TV.  Not 120 Hz, why buy?  Believe me, this is not a living room TV for entertaining family.  This is a side room tv that is a nice upgrade from a tube TV.  Great TV, 'nuff said.

Reviews.Title: Just get past the setup part
Reviews.Author: klik-klak
Reviews.Content: This is my first big-item order from Amazon and the Fedex guy brought it up to my apartment door, instead of the usual main entrance quick drop-off. I suppose it was because Amazon did not pack the TV into their standard packing boxes and it'd be a different kind of "steal" if left at my apartment building entrance.Setting up wasn't that difficult despite confusing instructions from the manual. Two points to note:1. Have a long-stemmed Philips screwdriver. I had to get a 4-inch stem from the hardware store. Thankfully it was just down the street.2. You can pretty much set up without the manual because there is only one way to fix the TV base (which consists of the flat base and the "trunk"). Just match the distance between the screw holes for both parts.The only grouse I have is one missing spongy-rubber pad. There're supposed to be 8 but I had only 7.Auto-tuning was a breeze, after which you can customize sound/picture settings to your preferences. I must say, the "clear voice" option is real sweet. So good luck and enjoy your purchase. As with all other electric appliances, they aren't built to last indefinitely anyway as manufacturers need the revenue. I'll be happy if it lasts me 5 years.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, Very Good Bargain
Reviews.Author: D. Payne
Reviews.Content: I bought this LG set as a second TV to replace an old 27" CRT standard def set. I have not used this LG to watch HD TV or movies, but have used it to play HD games on an Xbox 360. The picture quality during the games is very good. On any 32" set, I think you'll find a 720P picture to be more than adequate to enjoy the HD picture. Like most LCD TVs I've seen, this set doesn't produce a deep, rich black screen (there's still a little bit of a lightness effect on the default settings on a black screen), but this seems to be standard for LCDs (at least the ones that are not LED types, I haven't seen one of the LEDs up close). Standard def pictures are a little grainy, but this seems par for the course with HDTVs- I've never seen one that looks as good as an old CRT when displaying a standard def picture. I was surprised by the sound quality. When playing Halo: Reach, the simulated surround sound was pretty good - I could hear explosions and dialogue behind me when I was seated in the sweet spot in front of the TV. It's not going to match a separate surround sound system, but its not bad for a "small" TV speaker system. My main complaint about the set is that it has only two HDMI inputs, and the stand for the TV was a little bit awkward to screw into place (make sure you have a phillips screwdriver with a decent-length shaft). I definitely recommend this LG for those who want a second HDTV, or for the budget-conscious folks who want a small HDTV and don't care about having all the bells and whistles.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: kitty "kittyjoy22"
Reviews.Content: I am 63 and technology challenged. I was aprehensive about the set up. It was so easy even I had it done in a few minutes. The picture is fantastic. This is my first flat screen. I have had it a month and am extremely pleased. The sound is great also.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: mam
Reviews.Content: This tv replaced a Sony Bravia and Ihave to say it is much better the picture the colors and the sound.  My next tv purchase will be for a 47 inch LG.  This is a wonderful tv for viewing your favorite programs, watching blu-rays or dvd's and even for playing games it's fantastic.

Reviews.Title: The Good,  The Bad, and The Ugly - USB exploit!
Reviews.Author: sNAz
Reviews.Content: My house have a 50" Samsung LCD HDTV, 42" & 40" Panasonic Viera Plasma/LCD HDTV, Samsung 24" LCD, Acer 21.5" LCD, and now this LG 32" LCD HDTV.I did a 3 day research which includes reading over 60-100+ reviews on several 32" LCD HDTV. My decision came down to the LG 32LD350 and Toshiba 32C100U. A lot of reviews stated the LG 32LD350 had better color than the Toshiba 32C100U so that made my decision.THE GOODIt was Black Friday and I "WANTED" a 32" LCD HDTV for my bedroom and to dual screen my PC. Anything bigger than a 32" would be unnecessary since my room is smediumish. When the TV arrived, I had it hooked up to the HD cable to compare 720P vs 1080P (LG 720p vs Samsung 50" 1080p). To be honest I can't tell the difference b/w the two. Tested in several sport channels ( ESPN 1,2,3,etc...) and movies with mainly 720p and 1080p resolution. The difference is insignificant and not worth the extra [...] to get 1080P. The 32LD350 color is GREAT! picture is sharp and crisp with lots of extra features. BTW, the color needs to be adjusted and this HDTV is rated above mid entry HDTV in it's class.THE BAD & UGLYI didn't expect the sound to blow me away since it's a built in speaker but I didn't expect it to buzz neither. The speaker had this annoying buzz when I'm using it as a primary display for my PC. Almost sound like static and the only way to get rid of it was to turn the speaker off and use a separate speaker. I thought all my problems were solved but oh boy was I wrong. There was another buzz almost like a vibration sound and this time it was coming from the TV itself. Under normal circumstance you won't hear any static from the speaker or vibration from the HDTV if you're watching TV, only if you're connecting it to the PC in a quiet room. If your PC fan is somewhat normal/loud then it'll blend it with HDTV and you won't be affected by it. Those who have quiet/water cool system should look elsewhere.PC ConnectionNative resolution for modern 720p are 1366x768. Windows will only recognize 1360x768 as your native resolution but will also support 1920x1080 (down scale) using a DVI to HDMI adapter. The text will look fuzzy if your using a "NON NATIVE resolution". You can adjust the sharpness and use ClearType to remove some of the fuzziness but don't expect it to look like it should.At first, it was annoying, and hard, to get used to 1360x768 when my 24" Samsung LCD runs at 1920x1200 and Acer at 1920x1080. I knew this beforehand but I decided to go with a 720P anyways. The reason is because my Samsung and Acer is capable of running Full HD so no need to fork extra money. Surprisingly after a day of adjusting Window 7 "personalize" setting, I found 1366x768 not to shabby at all. So then I tested out 1366x768 vs 1920x1200 in gaming. Tested on CODMW2, HL2, CSS, Civilization V, and Crysis. Expected the unexpected, I thought there would be a huge difference in textures and details loss due to low resolution but I was wrong again. It might be the way  HDTV scales or what not but overall the good outweigh the bad. Gaming on this TV makes everything look bigger but the details are there compare to my Samsung/ Acer LCD. I've constantly switch the game from one monitor to another to check for details, textures, shadows, etc... and guess what.... "INSIGNIFICANT". I was so glad I purchase a 720 instead of spending an extra 150+ for a 1080. Now if your comparing a regular LCD 1366x768 (NOT HDTV) to a LCD with 1920x1200 then the details, textures, shadows, etc... would be significant. I've upgraded a lot of LCD's so I can tell the difference b/w each one. This LG 32" HDTV is an exception, maybe because HDTV have better scaling or newer technology? Whatever the case may be, the LG 32" HDTV is now my primary PC display. All my games looks so much better on it than my 24" Samsung due to better contrast, colors, and and insignificant details loss from higher to lower resolution.To get native resolution (1366x768) to work on your PC you need to install PowerStrip.1. Connect using DVI to HDMI Adapter. Don't use DVI to VGA, text are extremely blurry and custom resolution will not work.2. Update video card driver. Old drivers can be buggy and it'll fail at creating custom resolution.3. Create custom resolution using Nvidia Control Panel or ATI Control Panel. DO NOT APPLY  after creating custom resolution, 1366x768.4. Install PowerStrip and apply custom resolution at display profile.5. To play games using 1366x768 use Power Strip application profile.Why use 1366x768 instead of 1360x768? It's only 6 pixel different right?There is a difference! Not a big difference but a noticeable difference. I tested 1366x768 and 1360x768 on Civilization V. Both resolution give sharp and clear picture but with 1366x768 you can see more details on water, land, and mountains. Definitely noticeable.12/12/2010 - I've successfully exploit the USB port to display DIVX playback.

Reviews.Title: GET IT NOW!
Reviews.Author: Raven
Reviews.Content: Great tv!Once you get past the setup it's smooth sailing. Now I have tested all kinds of HDTVs. I also own a HP 1080p monitor and I own a emachines laptop that is 720p. There is truly no difference between 720p/1080i and 1080p. Don't let some fool you into thinking that it's a big difference. I watched bluray on this tv and it's just amazing. This tv also accepts a 1080p signal. No it's not true 1080p but it won't black out while watching it.I watched Dark Knight Star Trek Terminator Salvation on bluray all on this tv. They all looked amazing I also seen these three movies on my 1080p monitor again I didn't see any difference. If anything it looks better on a bigger screen even though my monitor is 1080p. So would I recommend this tv yes. Where can you get a tv for 348 dollars? With amazing quality as well not very many places. So get this tv while you can it's a steal. I was going to go with Sony Bravia but the LG more than satisfied my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Know what to do, and what you need
Reviews.Author: Scott B
Reviews.Content: First, I now own and love this TV.  Second there are a couple of things to be aware of, especially if you've never had an HD TV before.  If your input is coming from a cable box (learned this the hard way), be sure your box is set to send the right type of signal for the TV.  If, for example, your box is set for 480i output, you will not get the HD.  This is VERY SIMPLE to correct, and if you do not know how, your cable company can walk you through it with a simple call.  Also, don't forget to program the remote for that cable box to match your TV while you've got them on the phone.There is only a "OPTICAL DIGITAL AUDIO" output on the back.  This is not the standard speaker connection most of us remember or are used to.  If you get a speaker bar or surround sound system, be sure it has this type of connection.  The only other option is using the headphone jack for computer speakers, and if you do this, you need to get really good ones.  These are much cheaper than a home theater or speaker bar, and depending on your needs, they can be acceptable.Last thought.  My TV is in a corner entertainemnt unit that it fits into perfectly.  Too perfectly.  The power button is on the side/back and if you're tight on space, you'll need the remote to turn it off and on.The price is excellent.  Once you get your settings right for you, the picture is dynamic.  Shipping was quick.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Love it! Get one while the price is great!
Reviews.Author: A. Flowers "biologysupernerd"
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv. It practically set itself up right out of the box, just plug it in the wall, plug your cable box into it, and turn it on. You can customize the picture and sound to your liking with menu options. It was also surprisingly light and easy to move into place, even for a petite young woman with no upper body strength. The stand seems a teeeeeeny bit wobbly - if you don't have pets or small children you should be fine, but if you do, you should probably get a tie or some other kind of additional security, or wall-mount it. I'm a little nervous about letting my super-curious cats near my shiny new tv =)I'm also pleased with Amazon on this one. The price was great, I got free prime shipping that turned out to come in only one day, and I get their TV price & satisfaction guarantees if anyone changes their prices the rest of this week during BF deals.And for those little touches of completeness, LG also gives you batteries for the remote, and a microfiber cloth for cleaning the tv screen =) I bet those no-name tv's don't do that!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Shannon Striegle "shanahan"
Reviews.Content: This was an upgrade from our previous HD LCD TV.  I didn't think the old one was that bad until we got this one.  HUGE picture difference.  This one is so crystal clear and colorful, even from an angled view!  The functions are easy to use.  We have ours on the included stand, which doesn't seem to be very sturdy.  I'm really very pleased overall.

Reviews.Title: 32 inch lg  lcd tv
Reviews.Author: jeff
Reviews.Content: have had this set about a month , good picture, good looking set, easy to use remote, a lot of features , low price, I have no negative feedback so far.  Has a coaxial input and a swivel base. Would not hesitate to buy again.

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: always ON
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv after seeing in the store next to other tv's I was looking at buying. The biggest difference was the picture; the blacks were blacker than tv's with a better contrast ratio. Even though this tv does have a few less input/outputs the sale price and picture quality made it a better value to me.The instructions on how to use the tv remote could be a little better.

Reviews.Title: Great entry level HD TV
Reviews.Author: S Miller
Reviews.Content: This is my first HD TV, so I really have nothing to compare it to.  I opted for this model b/c it was more than half the price of the 46 inch model I really wanted.  Have had no problems at all, and really don't understand the complaints about the volume not being loud enough.  Volume is not an issue at all for us (family of 5, incuding 3 kids under the age of 11).  We have Dish Network HD connected to this TV, and the HD is amazing.  Great purchase...

Reviews.Title: A great entry-level HDTV
Reviews.Author: Kyle Albert
Reviews.Content: I just received this TV yesterday from Amazon for a steal compared to other retailers (333) to put in my dorm room this year and to sum it up for "tl;dr"ers: "Niccce... If you're looking for a great, relatively cheap HDTV for a bedroom, dorm room, or even a living room, pick this up"Pros:- Great picture quality for both SD/HD with complete customization for picture settings if you prefer different settings- Great sound quality; clearvoice is turned off by default but there is a positively noticeable difference when turned on.- Plenty of connections- Looks really nice; I really like the style of LG HDTVs- Built-in cable organizer to hide connection cables- Swivel stand- Comes with microfiber cloth to clean the glossy black surfaceCons:- Many have mentioned the bright red LED that is on when the TV is turned off.  Personally, it's not that bright and it does not annoy me so it's not a con for me.- Channel organization is a little funky if you aren't using a cable box (dorm room for example).  If you enter a channel with the remote, you may not get the channel that you actually want if you have multiple inputs (CATV and CADTV).  This of course is totally dependent on your cable setup.  When you type a channel, a "similar channel" list will pop-up and you can navigate quickly for the channel that you want if there are multiple channels for the number you typed.  Sounds confusing if you never had to deal with this before so I will give an example: My SD CNN channel is "28-0" but my HD FOX channel is "28-1," so when I type "28", it will default to FOX HD.  In order to get to CNN, I will have to type 28 and navigate the similar channels list that pops up.  If this really annoys you, just take advantage of the favorites list.Other thoughts:- Perfect for a dorm room or bedroom or somebody just looking for a relatively cheap HDTV.- I was really surprised how light this TV actually is (I never owned a flat-screen TV before).- Paper manual is useless except for setup and troubleshooting.  If you are looking for a guide on most of the TV's features, look at the CD manual.- MAKE SURE that you have AT LEAST a THIN 4 INCH PHILLIPS SCREWDRIVER for assembly (I'm talking to dorm room kids specifically).  I have a "6 in 1" screwdriver but the shaft was too wide to fit in the slot for the stand.  It should be no thicker than a standard No.2 pencil.  If you don't, you'll get the TV and then have to get a screwdriver to make sure it is 100% secure instead of watching the TV like you have been itching to do.Not much else to say.  I'm very satisfied with my purchase so far. I just hope LG quality control is top-notch so this TV lasts a long time.

Reviews.Title: Great unless you use the HDMI connection
Reviews.Author: Vince R
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality, low price, etc.However, after viewing from the HDMI input and then switching the video source back to Cable-TV (coax connector) or DVD (component), there can be no sound.  (Sometimes there is sound, sometimes there isn't sound.)  To fix this and hear sound again, you have to turn the TV off and then back on.This is the same problem N. Mehta mentions in his review and he rated the TV with 4 stars.  If you don't plan to ever use the HDMI input, then that's probably the correct rating for the TV.I do use the HDMI input for a DVR (like Tivo) so having to turn the TV off and back on when switching from the DVR to Cable-TV or the DVD player is quite inconvenient.  This is why I gave it a low rating.If you don't plan on ever using the HDMI input then this is a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: ncgrimes
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of reviews that go into detail about this TV. I got mine for 329.00 and I am very happy with my purchase. Shop around and find one that fits your needs. I sit 5 feet from this tv and use it for my xbox and netflix. With a HDMI cable I couldn't ask for anything more. When you get this size of a TV you dont need a 1080p. When you get larger TVs like 37 and larger then I'd suggest getting a 1080p.

Reviews.Title: LASTED ONLY A WEEK
Reviews.Author: Roberto Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: Cannot recommend this TV. After only 1 week, Speakers blew out. External audio out also did not work. LG CS was polite but unable to help.Replacement Phillips TV also had a better picture and better sound and I wound up getting it on sale and made $5 back.Philips 32PFL3505D/F7 32-Inch LCD HDTV, BlackOn the Plus side, Amazon online service for return and refund was picked up by UPS by next day and refund at 6th day from return. As promised.

Reviews.Title: This model DOES have a USB port for JPG viewing
Reviews.Author: Nabil Yazdani
Reviews.Content: This model is described incorrectly on Amazon. The 32LD350 is listed as having a USB port but that it is for "service only" and cannot be used for viewing JPG images. This is incorrect. The USB port allows viewing JPG and listening to MP3. I verified this with LG technical support. The smaller screen sizes only allow the USB to be used for service purposes but the 32" screen size has this added bonus.Amazon's description and it's chart (comparing all the different LG models) need to be corrected.

Reviews.Title: Simply had the best picture
Reviews.Author: Barb "is this heaven?"
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I wanted a larger television for our bedroom. I was blown away by the image quality. It was right next to a 32" Sony, Samsung and the LG was sharper, so that tipped the dial. I also like the clear voice feature since I'm hearing impaired. We also checked out the 1080 Lg of the same size, but the 720 still looked like the image quality was better, so there must be other factors into play. Minor quibbles: the manual that comes with the TV is almost nonexistent, the red glow off button is annoying, but from reading, I guess you can turn it off. It comes with a CD-Rom, which I have yet to look at. So, it's user friendly aside from further bells and whistles I haven't read about. If image quality is paramount, I don't think you can go wrong with this Tv.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the right price
Reviews.Author: fbara
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV from Amazon for $329.  It was the lowest price I found for a TV of this size and quality.  I did a few weeks of research and determined this unit had the features, quality, and price that I was looking for.  This TV will be used for a bedroom and it's just the right size; not so large as to look overwhelming and big enough to provide a easy-to-view image.TV was easy to setup, all you need to do is attach the pedestal base, for table-top use, or snap in a cover if you're going to mount on a wall.  LG's initial setup screen is simple and easy to follow.  You're presented with various screen options (brightness, color, contrast, etc.) along with images of what the ideal setting should look like so you know what effect your changes will have on the image.I have Dish Network and simply attached the Dish receiver to the TV via HDMI.  The LG remote is nicely laid out and allows quick access to the various TV's settings.  I've found that after the initial setup and a few hours of TV watching, I had to make a few tweaks to the color and contrast settings to get the image just the way I wanted it.  That was expected and the tweaks were minor.  The image quality is very good.  I also have a Vizio 32" LCD and this unit's picture quality is just a bit higher than the Vizio.  I would recommend this unit for a casual bedroom or small-room gaming environment.UPDATE 12/1/10: After using this TV for a few weeks, the only thing I wanted to add to my review was my dislike of the way the red power light, on the lower right-hand side of the unit, stays lit when the TV is off.  There's no way that I've found to turn this light off or dim it.  It's not obnoxiously bright, like my previously owned Vizio which would keep it's logo lit with white light at all times, but you will notice it if the TV is close to your bed (assuming it's placed in a bedroom).  When the unit is powered on the light turns blue and remains on.  When using the remote control, the blue light blinks with every button press.  Why do that?  I have several LCD TV's by different manufacturers and no other unit does this.  It's strange but only slightly annoying.  Overall picture quality is still fantastic and I still recommend buying it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, unbelievable value
Reviews.Author: Dave G
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews and did a lot of research before purchasing this tv. LG quality really shines in the picture quality of the tv. The contrast is nice and black levels are really impressive. I have this tv in my room so I didn't need the 1080p (cable only provides up to 720p), it is the perfect size for our bedroom. The sound is fine for a bedroom (a little tinny), but I would definitely connect to a stereo for a larger room. I got exactly what I paid for in this LG, a high quality picture and good sized screen for the bedroom. Very happy customer.

Reviews.Title: All the features most will need
Reviews.Author: buildrich
Reviews.Content: My first HDTV was thoroughly researched, relying heavily on the reviews on this and other sites. It finally narrowed down to this LG 32LD350 and a comparable Panasonic. The higher contrast ratio, the headphone jack (for alternative sound connection), the RF connector (antenna only -- no cable in my rural location) and the "Clear Voice" feature swung the decision in favor of the LG.Assembly was quite simple, as was setup. I found the default color settings to be very good.  There are no viewing blind spots anywhere in the bedroom.  I used one HDMI to connect a Panasonic DVR/VCR; the second to a laptop for streaming shows from the web; one of the AV's to an old VCR; and the RGB to a DVD player/VCR combo.The "Clear Voice" is an amazing improvement.  My wife's hearing loss had resulted in having to listen at an uncomfortably high volume -- no more!  Another nice sound feature is the option that equalizes volume between commercials and programming.  Now I don't have to wait for Congress to enact a law to force this issue.At the time of ordering, shipment was stated as being one week from order date.  As it turned out, order on Thurs 5PM, received on Saturday Fedex, and that was with Super Saver shipping.  I'd say that's excellent service.One more thing that I haven't seen any comments on: Did you know that prices fluctuate almost like the stock market?  During the week or so that this TV was in my cart, it ranged from a high of $378 to a low of $359, at which point I pounced on it.

Reviews.Title: best 720i TV
Reviews.Author: D. Kehoe "Monster Wrangler"
Reviews.Content: generally it's all about the image and after visiting several TV stores, the LG always stood out as having the best image quality for a 32 inch 720i TV.  the only 32" TV with a better image was the LG 1080i.  I was actually expecting a Samsung or a Sony to have a better image, but really, genuinely the LG was better.  amazingly it was also cheaper than the Samsung, and way cheaper than the Sony.The LG function's and menu's are very easy to use and are obvious.  I've never had use for the user manual.  A feature I really like is the energy saving button.  press it once and the screen goes to 75% brightness, then to 50% and 25%.  great if you're watching tv in the dark and don't want the screen too bright.only thing i would change would be to have an 'audio out' jack.  really good tv overall.

Reviews.Title: Best 32" LCD TV
Reviews.Author: kumslee
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV after a big research. For 6-8 feet viewing distance 32" TV is enough, and for 32" TV 720P, 60 Hz, and 50,000 contrast ratio is enough. 40"+ TVs only require 1080P, 120Hz, and 100,000 contrast ratio. So this TV better suits for my requirements and it came under my budget($350). LG is a very good brand too.I connect my laptop to this TV through HDMI. It works great and ease to use.The picture quality is awesome, the sound quality is not great but it doesn't seem like a con to me.When we connect a device(for example a pen drive) through USB port it detects it but once you come out of it there is no option to go back to the USB in the input options menu. I don't like this. I can say this is a con.Over all it's a big worth for the price.It got delivered way ahead of time.*I got 15+ dollars back under low price guarantee too.

Reviews.Title: Amazon/LG Buy
Reviews.Author: pamela
Reviews.Content: To 'New' buyers @ Amazon: Shopping/Buying couldn't flow any easier!  After much research & shopping for an LCD TV, then narrowing down to brand & size I found that Amazon made the most sense as to 'where' to buy (signed up and received 'free shipping'), best pricing.  For a brand along with price, I found that LG was the way to go!The 32" LD350 arrived on time; carton was in excellent condition.  Since I'm the 'installer' in my family (I've already setup 4 others) my setup was a breeze.  If this was the first, it still would of been.  Self explanatory directions.  The tv is picture perfect (pardon the pun)!  Size, color, sound and a 'swivel' base, etc. I'm extremely pleased with all.  LG's remote for the menu is very user friendly, and the menu is the same.  Would highly recommend both an LG & Amazon.  I purchased for the bedroom; the only comment is I could have gone a bit smaller.Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Everything we wanted
Reviews.Author: TaunyaD
Reviews.Content: After standing in Best Buy starting at flat screens for almost an hour, this is the one we decided on.  The colors are bright, it's not at all grainy and we've had no issues with the sound.  Amazon had the best price around.  I couldn't have been happier with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: Amazon LCD
Reviews.Author: Jorge S
Reviews.Content: The LG is an excellent TV. Everything about it is good. Setup was very easy, which is good considering that it was a gift for an old couple who's not tech savvy. If you can find this TV for 399 or less, do not pass it up. It'll easily outdo any Vizio or Samsung TV's in this range and at a price like this you simply can't beat it. The picture is good, and I haven't had problems with the viewing angle. The remote is well laid out and the on screen menus look good the best I have seen. The screen is very bright and clear and the remote is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Christmas tv
Reviews.Author: Momward
Reviews.Content: I finally decided it was time for Mom to have something rather than a 13" tv to watch in the computer room.  I waited until this one came up on Amazon.  LG's gotten good reviews in Consumer  Reports.  I am more than pleased with everything about this item.  I can't believe how light it was to pick up!  Delivery time was excellent!  A new client for life!

Reviews.Title: Quality and Price...
Reviews.Author: James T. Contardo "JimmyC"
Reviews.Content: This Christmas season, I bought gifts for lots of people so I decided to treat myself to one too.  I am no stranger to LCD TV's.  In 2004, I began the quest to transition to LCD.  It cost me $3600 at Circuit City to buy two 22" units!  More recently, I purchased a 37" Philips which broke down during the warranty.  It went into a local repair shop for 2 months, battling Philips to make good on the warranty. Finally the TV was returned to us, only to have a real nice new problem where it went off and on constantly.  Philips agreed to replace it after weeks of calling, but did not have any 37" LCD TV's refurbished so a 42" Plasma was sent instead.  Junk.  It too stopped working after 4 months.  Here is a nice thing they don't tell you: If your new TV has a 1 year warranty and breaks after 3 months, and replaced with a refurb, the refurb only carries a 90 warranty. They will not honor the 1 year warranty or even the remainder of that one year that came on the original set!!OK, sorry I deviated from the subject of the LG350, a 720P, 60Hz machine.  For the money, this is a superior machine.  Depending on what website you look at, the dynamic contrast is either 50,000 to one, 70,000 to one or even 100,000 to one.  Regardless of that gray area, all websites claim it has a 4MS response time (how long it takes for one individual pixel to go from one color to another.  This specification is another gray area and is not always specified on many LCD TVs, and usually for good reason...because it is probably a higher number (lower is better on this one).  What this one technical attribute means is the difference between seeing the Boston Celtics on a FAST break, or seeing them shimmy down the court.  In other words the TV's with higher response times do not handle fast motion very well and like my junk Philips plasma, it is the difference between enjoying whatever your watching or being distracted by the picture's flaws. This LG350 has THE lowest response rate of any 32" HDTV I have found.  And trust me, I looked at them all!Beyond the great picture (color, contrast, brightness), the sound is excellent for 14watts of output.  The menus are all easy to manage, the stand swivels, it does closed captioning, several color temperatures, several different picture modes (sports, cinema, etc).  I almost forgot a very important benefit of this TV: I have TW Cable, expanded basic so most channels are analog with a handful of digital channels.  The analog channels look very good but the digital channels are excellent...crystal clear.  It has a goodly amount of inputs including USB to display video from a camera or digital photos (it has a neat thing to enhance stills called Picture Wizard).It has a quality look and feel to it and even though it is not 1080P, it is really a very nice HDTV for the money.  Don't cheap out.  Go with a name brand (except Philips) or suffer the misery of looking at a black screen!

Reviews.Title: Excelent LCD TV
Reviews.Author: PereGrinoz
Reviews.Content: I'm really  happy with this TV.It has a very good image quality, I download movies as BR-RIP from the internet and are excellent on this TV.Also I can connect my 320GB external hard drive and play my MP3 files and photos, or both simultaneously.The difference between this version and the LED is the LED version is a little more glossy but otherwise all the same ..I recommend this TV to everyone ...Excellent product, good price ...PD: Sorry my bad english...

Reviews.Title: Great for the price!
Reviews.Author: K. Hartwell
Reviews.Content: Stuff I love:Backlight adjustments.  I like that I can turn the backlight up if I am watching a movie with dark scenes or down if I need to.  It is much more simple than it is for most other TVs.  Along these same lines, I love the energy saving modes if I am listening to music through the TV or feeling guilty about my carbon footprint.Mode adjustments.  I rotate between gaming and watching movies frequently so it is nice to change the AV mode without having to go through an overloaded menu.  Instead you just hit one button on the remote!TV screen.  The screen has no obnoxious light reflections which is great since it faces my bedroom window!  The darks are dark and the lights are light.  I honestly cannot tell that it is only 720p and not 1080 like my family's other television.Could be better:The speakers are not very loud, but they are more than enough for now.  If I really need to, I will buy a soundbar in the next few years.There is a little red light on the TV that shines very brightly when it is turned off.  It can get really annoying if you are trying to sleep and the light bothers you.  I have put painters tape over it myself.Overall, this is a great television for the price!  Of course there are things that could be better, but I am extremely happy with this TV.  Perfect for large bedrooms or small living rooms.  Easy to assemble, lightweight, and great for students or young professionals!

Reviews.Title: Best deal around
Reviews.Author: mikey tro
Reviews.Content: I looked at a lot of different brands and different sites, ultimately finding this TV and specifically the price on amazon to be significantly better than any other website.In my opinion it's the best priced LCD from a company that I feel comfortable investing in...unlike some of the more sketchy cheaply priced LCD brandsIt was easy to set up and the controller/menus are very intuitive, within 10 minutes out of the box I had my xbox 360 hooked up to the hdmi and ready to go  (and let me tell you the difference in quality going from a tube tv/component video to LCD/hdmi is exponentially better...I now wonder how I put off buying a new TV for so long)My only complaint is that the TV sways when you touch it.  Not really a big deal since I never really touch it and I've seen cheaper stands for similar TVs.overall very happy with my purchase

Reviews.Title: Don't Hesitate to Buy
Reviews.Author: Not a Newbie
Reviews.Content: Great TV and picture using just my cable box delivering digital TV and not HDTV.  Those who say the sound is weak obviously haven't played with the sound options and turned on ClearVoice.  Would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny!
Reviews.Author: Lakshmi P. Janardhanan "Lakshmi Prasad"
Reviews.Content: This is my first LCD-HDTV. After so much thought and research I settled for this TV. And I am very happy about my decision. This TV is worth every penny that I spent on it. This TV delivers one of the best picture quality on my Verizon Hi-Def TV connection. I also browse internet and watch lot of youtube videos (I got the simple laptop VGA to RGB connector as I don't have HD output from my DELL Inspiron laptop. And I also got the MK-300 series wireless keyboard and mouse combo). It just feels great to sit back on the couch and browse internet/watch videos on the TV without the hassles of wires. I also have hooked my wii console to one of the AV inputs. And it works great too. Last but not the least, I am double happy about the fact that I got this TV tax free(Pennsylvania)+shipping free from Amazon.com.

Reviews.Title: Worked great... until it stopped working after an hour
Reviews.Author: KatieB
Reviews.Content: Ordered the tv about 2 weeks ago, came super quick since I'm an amazon prime member. Couldn't wait to play with it, but I had to put it back in the box after about an hour later so I could transport it to college. Moved into school yesterday and hooked up the cable and it worked great. Until it stopped working. Worked for literally about an hour until I turned it off and hooked up the wii and playstation. Went to turn it back on and found that the remote didn't work (even with new batteries) nor did the buttons on the side of the tv. Tried removing all of the cables that connected the game systems and cable, still nothing. Switched outlets, nothing. Occasionally it would turn on and be all fuzzy, but couldn't change channel or get a menu. Called LG to try to do some troubleshooting but couldn't actually understand the man on the phone (outsourced call center?) but he made arrangements for someone to come out and "service" the tv on Wednesday. In the mean time, I gave amazon a call and they are sending a new one, which will hopefully work if the repair guy can't fix it. Was really hoping for the easy tv that everyone claimed this was, but so far I've just had problems. It did work great...when it did actually work.

Reviews.Title: 720 vs 1080
Reviews.Author: Ginger
Reviews.Content: I got this tv about 10 days ago. It has a beautiful picture.I called Lg to register the tv. In NY I subscribe to Cablevision. They informed me if I had a 720, I would not get a picture if programmed to 1080. I told them I was getting a picture.I called customer service at LG andthey informed me it was a 1080SURPRISE.  CHECK IT OUT

Reviews.Title: Amazon rocks
Reviews.Author: nevada jay "nevadajay"
Reviews.Content: Not sure if this will make it on the feedback, but I have to call out the absolute fantastic customer service from Amazon with this order.I ordered this TV and had it shipped to my home.  I wasn't home when it was delivered, so UPS left the package at the front door...in a pile of snow!  I have no idea what they were thinking, but by the time I got home, the entire bottom of the box was absolutely soaked through.  I didn't even bother opening the TV to test it - I didn't want the risk (water + h2o = bad news).So I called Amazon and couldn't believe the level of service.  They immediately created a new order for me and had it shipped overnight.  It was a total of a 24hr delay.  I couldn't be happier with Amazon's service, which is why I buy nearly every purchase over $20 from them.Thank you Amazon!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: A great TV with a great set of features.-Clear Voice II is great, the only problem is that it isn't turned on by default.-The dynamic contrast is great but again you have to turn it up yourself.-Tons of connections-Picture is amazing for the priceThe only thing I don't like about the TV is the stand. It's a tad wobbly.

Reviews.Title: First time Buyer of Flat Screen
Reviews.Author: Kevin M. Wilkin
Reviews.Content: Just got this Tv a few days ago,and let me say that this thing is awesome . It met all my expectation.first of all this Tv is super lite ,compared to my 32" RCA tube tv that it replaced. When i actually got it ,i even doughted that a tv was in the box because of how light the box was...sms .Set up was a breeze took me about 7 minutes to get it done . The picture on this is great,baring in mind that i am in the caribbean and the cable reception is not of the best quality . The features and menu are great .The set looks ultra thin. i have saved a bundle of space now that i got this .The only draw back on this set is the sound ,my RCA sounds a lot better that this does ,but of course it has more space for bigger speaker than the LG. A easy way to remidy this is to get some computer speaker with a subwoofer  and you will be amazed with the sound .No need to spend a bundle of cash on a home theater system especial if your room is small, trust me on this .All in all the best Tv i have bought ,just what i wanted.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Bargain
Reviews.Author: Gee Dub
Reviews.Content: Actually Wal Mart made the final decision for me to buy this tv from amazon,due to there lack of customer service,which ended up saving me about 70.00 in the end the price of the TV itself was 11 bucks cheaper and the wall mount was around 60.00 cheaper ,Reviewing the TV itself I am really suprised at the quality of picture ,sound and overall ease of set up and use. Yes its a 720P and only 60hz technology TV,but most cable companies are spitting out 1080 anyway I have a 47 inch LG in my living room with 1080/120hz and you cannot tell the diff in pic quality on the two I am very pleased for this being a bedroom tv and one my three year old can watch his movies on when he wants its perfect,and its so light made it perfect for hanging on the wall overall I personally dont think you can find a better price for this quality of TV.Thinking of buying another to use in my computer room as a Monitor/TV,price a 32 inch monitor for you computer you will see what I mean very pleased with this purchased,it arrived in the LG box with a hole all the way thru the center like it was struck with a arrow,but the TV itself was unharmed,how this happened i havent a clue.Oh btw thanks wal mart for pushing me to buy online if you dont have any customer service then may as well save money and by online!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Very good LG HDTV
Reviews.Author: D. Hawkins "R&B; music lover"
Reviews.Content: Purchased my LG 32inch HDTV for bedroom use in Dec 2010. This TV is impressive. Excellent picture quality, very good sound, and high quality casing. I had sum exposure to this LG tv at the Navy Lodge in Maryland. It leaves and excellent impression when you consider the rich and detailed image quality, vibrant colors, and great sound. Bright picture so no misses with dark scenes. High quality remote and some good features that's not common. I'm especially happy having wake up timer at this price level. One thing missing, only has 2 HDMI ports, this means the second HDMI hookup in on the side and then you'll see dangling wire. Also considered 32inch Samsung and was happy to decide LG considering the bang for buck deal. Well worth my purchase and has an excellent price. Amazon is awesome.

Reviews.Title: great tv....
Reviews.Author: david williamson
Reviews.Content: the television was delivered within 4 days (standard shipping), in excellent condition and at a great price.  very easy to set up and use.  the remote is put together quite nicely and very functional.  the sound is very good on this tv.  we use it in our bedroom and are watching from about 14 feet away.  i am very happy with this purchase.  thanks amazon.

Reviews.Title: LG HDTV
Reviews.Author: Doris M. Knapp
Reviews.Content: Very Pleased with my purchased. Received in a timely manner and was in excellent condition. Great picture. I'm enjoying my new TV very much.Thank-you.

Reviews.Title: looks good all around
Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: Just purchased before Christmas as a gift for my Dad. He loves it. So far, so good. Picture quality is fine, we are not tech geeks and would find it difficult to see a major difference between some units unless it was a blazing lemon.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and VERY easy set up
Reviews.Author: Bryna VanEis
Reviews.Content: I literally plugged it in, attached my hdmi cable from my receiver and it was working beautifully. I had no trouble at all and the picture is very clear and sharp. The user interface for the menu is nice and easy to use. Great buy!

Reviews.Title: Mom Loves it!!!!
Reviews.Author: NY Rose "Rose"
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for my elderly Mom. The picture is crisp, bright and clear. It's easy for her to operate but that's because we set it all up and she simply has to use the cable remote which she's very used to. Having said that, WE found its operation clear and straight forward. Since she spends so much time watching, it's great for her to be able to see her shows in HD. The look and quality is excellent. It even has a USB port on the side so we were able to show her all the digital photos we had taken that day on this large, vibrant screen. VERY HAPPY with the purchase. Considering buying another for my bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with this product
Reviews.Author: Austin Vet
Reviews.Content: This is our second LG television and we will probably buy a third one. We have five sets in our house and the LGs are the best of the four different brands. They are very easy to set up and they look nice.

Reviews.Title: LG 32LD350 32-inch 720p 60 hz HDTV
Reviews.Author: Golden
Reviews.Content: The TV was purchased for the living room with limited viewing.  It was delivered within two days of purchase. Dish TV is the video source.  The picture is GREAT, assembly of the stand, a snap, set up, easy even for an old person.  I do not use internet connection or DVD on this set, so I can not remark on these features.  If you are looking for a reasonably priced HDTV in the 32 inch size, I recommend you look at this model.

Reviews.Title: So far so very good.
Reviews.Author: wunderbar
Reviews.Content: I'm replacing a 19" HDTV with this LG beaut.Made up my mind during the holiday I wanted a new laptop external monitor,a sizable one. Decided on the LG 32LD350 after originally deciding on the Panasonic counterpart and realizing almost too late that there was no analog audio support with that model, neither a PC audio in or headphone jack.So I quickly shifted my interest to this model and pulled the trigger. It arrived today, I couldn't be happier with this purchase.After reading some reviews I was a little worried about how difficult it would beto screw in the base with my very unsophisticated screwdriver - no problem at all.In fact, the entire set up from the time I opened the box to getting it up and running was approx. 10 minutes.I am a student - got rid of cable TV to cut down on expenses months ago - but I have adigital antenna; easy to plug into the TV and the quality of picture exceeds my expectation - a wonderful picture - and I believe the TV is working with the antenna better than its protege..I've got a 13" macbook hooked up to the RGB plug on the back of the LG 32",the picture originally was disappointing but after a moment of fumbling (just a moment), the menu guided me to an auto adjust feature and bam - a very satisfactory picture.I have a DVI to HDMI cable being delivered tomorrow so I hope to eek out a bit more definition, so I'll let you know how it goes.Even the audio is adequate - although I hooked up some nice speakers without any trouble and have a connector to the laptop that integrates the audio. I'm happy to reiterate what many many others have said, that for the price this is a real find. My grandmother had a 42" before she passed that must have cost 3x the amount of this TV and I believe in my short assessment that the quality of her picture was inferior to this. Hope this helps you make an informed decision.

Reviews.Title: Stunning!
Reviews.Author: JMichael "Jay"
Reviews.Content: This a review from someone who knows little about the technical specs of HDTV's, or the comparison of one brand or technology to another.  I only had 'regular', non-HD TV's before this, so the difference with the LG HDTV is incredible.  For a very reasonable price, this was a tremendous upgrade.  The picture is stunning, even on regular channels.  We hooked it up to my step-son's blu-ray player (high def DVD's) last night, and that was even more amazing, clear and vibrant. I think the sound is wonderful; lots of sound separation and dynamic range (especially on DVD's).  It has a 'home theatre' quality even without all the external speakers.  (I have to say that my step-son, who is much more sophisticated in such matters, rated the sound as 'OK - for built in TV speakers'.) If you're new to the world of HDTV and wondering if you should take the plunge, I'd certainly say you can't go wrong with this TV as your entry point.

Reviews.Title: LG is a great HDTV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Life Is Good
Reviews.Content: This LG had all the features I was looking for. The headphone input is a plus most 32" LCD's do not have one. Plenty of other inputs as well. Picture is also great! The sound is as I expected, if you want booming sound then get a surround sound system. This was purchased for the bedroom so I didn't expect big sound out of this small 32". Overall I'm happy with my purchase and like the LG slogan "Life Is Good!"

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV
Reviews.Author: Robert P. Harrison "tennis  freak"
Reviews.Content: Ordered for my wife to watch at about 12 feet.I spent several weeks reviewing the 32 inch sets from Samsung ,Panasonic, and LG.We were not disappointed,superb picture,sound,and ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: morris264
Reviews.Content: LG 32" LCD TV.  Great TV right out of the box.  Connected to satellite system and turned it on.  No adjustments necessary.  Have not yet loaded the instructions on CD yet so there may be more features than I am using. Low weight allowed me to use a swivel mount.  (18 lbs.)

Reviews.Title: Great buy for the money!
Reviews.Author: Joan Wankmiller "rjmmama"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my son and his wife for an early Christmas gift at a fantastic price on Amazon.  They rave about it constantly.  Great picture and sound.  After comparing others to this one, I found it the best buy.  Little did I know that it would be such a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: Bruce Weddendorf
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these for the bedroom a few months ago, and we liked it so much I bought another for the kitchen. This is the best quality 32" TV for a low price I could find, and after using for a few months, I would buy them again.

Reviews.Title: A Wonderful Household Addition
Reviews.Author: Norman N. Mcdonald
Reviews.Content: FINALLY - AN EAR PHONE JACK - YES!!!  A feature not mentioned in description or found on most TVs anymore.  Went to Big Box store and found only 1 TV with an Ear Phone Jack so I can watch TV late at night while others sleep.  This was the one and after looking at every website imagineable found it $70.00 cheaper via AMAZON, even on Black Friday or Cyber Monday.  Picture is glorious!  Lots of bells and whistles we'll probably never use.  Unexpected bonus is that it picks up all of the Digital Channels from Cable Service without a Cable Box plus several HD channels with Dolby as well.  Cannot explain why - they just all appeared after manual Channel Scan during set up procedure described in instructions.  Do not miss this [set-up] step - you may be pleasently surprised, too.

Reviews.Title: Nice second TV
Reviews.Author: S. Martin "Schmoopy.Design"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a second TV to place in my home office so I can watch football while I work. The TV is sweet and looks great mounted on a great mount (VideoSecu) that I also got on Amazon. The sound is a bit wonky but it's no big deal. Added perk is that it has a USB port which lets you listen to music and view photos. There is also plenty of information on how to exploit the USB port and enable it to view videos from a USB drive making the TV your personal media center. Overall you can't beat the price - nearly $50 cheaper than Walmart, free shipping and no tax. You're not going to find a better deal.

Reviews.Title: A nice purchase.
Reviews.Author: Blues22475
Reviews.Content: This is a very good tv for the price. I am not much of a TV Guru nor do I know a whole lot about it, but I do know enough to tell what makes a television suck. This TV is a great purchase considering the price. It's features are pretty nice, and if you are new to the world of HD televisions it's not too bad to get used to.The features it includes is a filter mode which shifts the settings to a couple of predetermined ones so if you're not wanting to spend alot of time to tweak your tv with all the settings this is the way to go. Also, this comes with an "input" mode which you can use to the various kinds of inputs this tv supports (composite, AV, DVI HDMI VGA). This is good for if you use this machine to watch cable television and quickly switch to one of the other outputs. If you're a gamer this is a nice feature. Moreover, each input method will hold whatever filter settings (maybe others too but I haven't tried that yet) you assign it. So your cable input method could be set to "Cinema" filter while your composite input could be set to "Game" filter(which is my setup currently). Also you do have a "favorites" channel list you can program you feel like it, and there is a feature that will search for all your channels (TV, CATV,HD channels etc). Just be aware this could take awhile if you plan to do it through the automatic channel search.The sound quality is quite good. The only downside (as mentioned in a previous review) I can think of is that the speakers don't blast forward: it's back and downwards. All the same, the sound quality is quite good (and a welcome change to the mono sound of an analog tv).The TV itself is pretty solid. Although if you put it together with the default base it comes with you might have a wobbly tv. You can rotate the tv just a bit if you install it with the default base, but it's quite wobbly.The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that I discovered a "Dead Pixel" (more technically a "lit pixel") on my display about a week or so after I purchased it. Regardless, if you're new to the market of HD TV's this is a pretty good buy if you want something that is decent and not expensive.

Reviews.Title: Not a monitor, but good for video
Reviews.Author: R.M.
Reviews.Content: I picked up this flat screen largely for the price for the size, as a starter set to replace my clunky old CRT screen, and I am happy I did.While this set is apparently not energy-star compliant, there are power-savings options that work by dimming the screen a bit.  It's unnoticeable at the "minimum" setting, acceptable at the "medium" setting, and too dim at the "maximum" setting.I was happy to see that the LG included the SVGA-type PC video input.  At the 32" screen size, 720p is really not dense enough to work as a monitor-replacement, and reading fine text will strain your eyes.  However, it works very well for displaying streaming video like netflix or hulu.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic HDTV for PS3 and HD Channels
Reviews.Author: Jay A. Hayes
Reviews.Content: I'm a college student and I'm very tech-savvy. I have a Playstation 3, laptops, desktops, and netbooks; I'm also a bit of an audiophile, so I hope my review is credible. I purchased this HDTV in February of this year. It came well packaged and everything worked when I turned it on. The first thing I want to say is this: this is an HDTV so in order to utilize the HD abilities of this TV, you need to look at HD content or hook-up peripheral devices via HDMI. Otherwise, it will look like any other TV. With that said, lets review this TV based on these HD qualities.HD Channels look stunningly beautiful! I bought my PS3 the same time as I purchased this TV. I hooked it up via HDMI (another note: the better your HDMI cord, the better the picture...just saying) and I watched The Dark Knight in Blu-Ray, just to test the picture quality. I'm not over exaggerating when I say that the picture is so beautiful, it would make you want to cry :). There are also different picture modes to choose from, so if the picture doesn't look as well as you would like it to, the different picture settings should help. I just built my first Desktop and it has HD capabilities, so I tested it on my TV....gorgeous!The sound. It's great! It can get really loud. I never put it above 35. I'm sure that in a bigger room it would need to be turned up more. I have this in my room. All of my friends are envious of my TV...they all have tube TVs in their dorms :). My father bought the 1080p version of this TV...lemme tell you now...don't. All that cute little yahoo internet and stock stuff is for show...it's a nice wasteful feature but the picture doesn't look any better then my TV. Honestly, I think my TV looks better. Blu-Ray on the 1080p LG TV looks fake...if that makes sense. It's pretty bad...don't waste the money. 720p is great. My desktop and PS3 can spit out 1080p...and I've seen 1080p...honestly no difference.This TV is of great value...there are plenty of HDMI slots. You can have a desktop, cable box, and gaming system hooked-up via HDMI. It has an optical out port...which is useful for a home theater system. It's an amazing TV, I adore it and I wouldn't trade it in for anything else.Final note, don't waste your money on an 3D television, wait for it to be standard like the HDTV. It's a waste of money, and the 3D isn't really that good. Plus, you will have to shell out lots of money to even buy the 3D movies...there isn't enough out yet to support the TV...don't do it. BUT BUY THIS TV!

Reviews.Title: Good TV, Good Price
Reviews.Author: The Vibesman
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for about two months now.TV has a very nice picture, used mainly for viewing HDTV, DVDs and MKV/AVI videos from media player.  Was expecting sub-par sound and pleasantly surprised by the sound quality and options offered for fine-tuning sound.  If you can make do with two HDMI inputs this is a really good buy. I think it could use at least one more HDMI.Was shipped via UPS; those guys took their sweet time getting it here.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: EMB
Reviews.Content: I brought 2 of my tech savvy friends in on this purchase and they researched everything from contrast to potential for "ghosting".  The only thing this TV didn't seem to score as high on as its top line competitors were sound quality, but we've got this as a TV in our bedroom, so I haven't noticed any issues with it at all.  I still have it just (4) stars in this area since for other uses, people may notice this compared to other brands.Picture quality is awesome and the look of the TV itself is great!!  Very happy with this purchase and definitely the best price around!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Mandy Payne "Is it just me?"
Reviews.Content: I have only had the TV for about a month, so I can't speak to the long term durability and performance.  But so far, this TV has been surprisingly great for the price.  It is lightweight and moves easily.  It is the lower high def, 720p, so I wasn't expecting the amazing picture quality that this TV offers.  I stream movies from netflix and from my computer and they look great. 32 inches is perfect for a bedroom or playroom.I wish I had more tech knowledge to share.  All that I do know is that this little TV made a very sick child very happy and I am exceedingly pleased with the quality.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the price
Reviews.Author: George
Reviews.Content: Nothing about this TV is fancy, but it has a fine picture and works well. The stand has too small a footprint and the TV seems top heavy. I fear it may be a tipping hazard. If you have children, be sure to place the TV where it is out of reach. It should be fine mounted on a wall.

Reviews.Title: Great TV.  Great price.
Reviews.Author: c24
Reviews.Content: This TV looks and works great.  It's mounted on the wall and I have no problems at all with the quality of the picture.  I have read the reviews about all of these LCDs with regard to sound quality.  This seems better than most,(and that is why I chose LG) though it lacks a little depth and volume, but that seems to be endemic with all of the wall-mounted TVs.

Reviews.Title: Love the Picture, Sound and Features Need Improvement
Reviews.Author: JJ Stark
Reviews.Content: This is our first flat screen/LCD/HD TV (it's also our first LG).  I think the TV is excellent for the price we paid (<$400).  The picture quality is amazing on the HD channels of our local cable company.  Some images look as if they're in 3D, they're so crystal clean with amazing color and egdes.  Some channels look like they're 1080 rather than the 720 then this TV is set for.  The menus are easy to use and figure out.  Set up was a cinch (EXCEPT for the stand which is an extremely poor design -- VERY difficult to get two of the screws to lineup and took us longer to accomplish this than set up the TV, connect it to the cable box and find our ideal settings).  The CLEAR VOICE option is great, and I like that you can turn it on or off, and adjust the level at which you want the clear voice to be heard.  I've picked up lines in movies I've seen hundred of times that I'd never heard before!What I don't like about the TV is that most of the sound settings sound a little "canned" or hollow.  For example, when set to the CINEMA setting, I don't detect any obvious difference from the SPORTS or GAMING or even my PERSONAL?USER SETTINGS.  There's an echo or emptiness to the sound.  I know I can purchase a sound system and/or higher quality speakers, but I don't want to spend addtl money for better sound.  Overall it's good sound quality, but I wish it sounded more solid and around me.I also don't like the fact that there's no CAPTION option when using an HDMI or Component Cables.  The only way to access the Caption feature is to use the Antenna input.  This seems more like a downgrade rather than an upgrade from our previous TV.  I prefer to watch television with the captions on, and while I can turn them on through our cable box, I'd prefer to control them through the TV along with the volume and picture features.Overall, very happy with the TV and while this was our first LG purchase, I'm certain it won't be our last - I'd highly recomment LG for your next TV

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect
Reviews.Author: Stain
Reviews.Content: Just got this hooked up last week.Pros:1) Picture is SUPER awesome.2) It weighs about as much as a postage stamp...I swear I could stick it to the wall with a piece of scotch tape.3) The 14-day price guarantee from Amazon saved me almost 30 bucks.Cons:1) When the TV is off, a red light glows on the lower right corner of the front panel.  It turns blue when it is on, which makes sense, but why do I need a light to tell me it's OFF???  This TV is in our bedroom, so it's a little annoying to have a red light glowing at me all night.  Who's the Einstein that thought a light to show when the TV is OFF was a GOOD idea???  The lights on everything else I own go out when not in use...but not this TV.  I don't get it.Other than that, it's a great TV.

Reviews.Title: LG Great Value
Reviews.Author: chicagocemo
Reviews.Content: While I prefer Samsung the price on the LG was much more competitive for the same feature set. Great bargain and size is perfect for a small room.

Reviews.Title: LG must stand for Luxury Goods
Reviews.Author: Lee Winston Wright
Reviews.Content: We're pleased as punch with our new TV which arrived several days ahead of the most optimistic arrival date given. It's only been a couple of weeks so too soon to have it catch on fire or otherwise disappoint but we are very positive about the future.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: S. Webster
Reviews.Content: Sometimes the sound is fuzzy/vibrating like.  Other than that it is great.  We have it hanging in our bedroom.  Perfect location!  Picture quality is great!  I would recommend this for those who need a secondary TV/don't watch much since the sound isn't always perfect.

Reviews.Title: LG 32LD350
Reviews.Author: canusee menow
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the $ the picture especially ... WoW me likey! You will need a phillips screwdriver at least 4" long to assemble the stand (quick n easy chore) The set up is also simple (clock, channel scan etc.).The remote is sturdy, not flimsy it's functions are well thought out ... logical. There are eight custom image settings you can program: sports, vivid, cinema etc ... you can swap between them quickly to find the best image for what you are watching. 20 watts going to the speakers and they sound good, no thumping bass but not tinny weaky squeaky, volume can be turned up pretty loud if needed. I'm happy with the TV though there are somethings this one lacks maybe because it is a lower end product and features are where they shave the prices....There is no option to see a channel guide it will only show information for the program you are currently watching (if you change the time ahead it will show you future programing). There is no way to have the image fill the entire screen when watching 480i or 720p broadcasts, which seems odd, don't other tv's can do that? As a computer monitor with windows XP and my old agp w/DVI out graphics card there is no way to set custom resolutions so it is a few pixels off, causing slightly fuzzy images but text on web pages/games is easy to read none the less.Further information on this can be found in this helpful review:http://218.201.42.40:8080/www.amazon.com/review/R3CSLGZUZ24HDJ/ref=cm_srch_res_rtr_alt_1With window7 I believe resolution are set correctly automatically ... anyone know for sure?I would recommend this set if it is a fit with your budget, but I do wish it had an onscreen program guide like my DTV box did. If you have cable or satellite TV I imagine you have a program guide anyhoo so no worries.4.5 stars ... great TV!

Reviews.Title: Happy for the price
Reviews.Author: LisaC "LMC"
Reviews.Content: This was a major upgrade from my little 19 in from college. I read the reviews and it looks solid and comparable, plus I could not find a better price anywhere else. The TV so far is fantastic; it works well in my living room and the picture quality and set-up for your picture quality was surprising and easy. So far so good. I have not had any problems with the set yet! I plan on hopefully getting another for the bedroom. I would recommend this.5/9/2013Well a new update. I have moved this television into the bedroom and it is still working like a champ. The picture quality and sound have not slipped since I purchased the t.v. more than a year ago. Plus moving into the bedroom, along came the new dvd player and playstation 3, but there are plenty of hook-ups on the back. I couldn't have been happier with this product.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous BUY!!!!
Reviews.Author: bzeemom
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my daughter who went from a televsion about the size of a picture frame to this fabulous 32 inch LG HD TV!  It's fabulous and she loves it!!!! Plus, it was such a great buy on Black Friday!

Reviews.Title: worth every inch
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: Pros : easy on the wallet and the eyes, image looks great for sd as well as hd, easy setup for people like my parentsCons no apps or 120hz but for this price u wont do bettera good buy,will update after 100 hr for good measure

Reviews.Title: Ed's new tv
Reviews.Author: Mr. 50
Reviews.Content: Very nice tv, gave it as a gift, receiving person loved it, very good price, deliveron time when scheduled

Reviews.Title: Pleasant Experience
Reviews.Author: Jesse R. Niederer
Reviews.Content: I visited a number of stores to see the differences between 32" TV's before I ordered this one. I found that the led screens were a bit brighter and the 1080i resolution was a little clearer. That said, I am very happy with this TV.  Set-up was a dream and it looks great in my bedroom. The sound is more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: LG 32 LCD TV
Reviews.Author: freddie
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV for the price. I already have a similar one and decided that another like this was best for what I needed.  Delivery was fast.

Reviews.Title: Value for money @ a great price.
Reviews.Author: Doodledandy "Old fart and music lover!"
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat sceptical at buying a LG product, but I have to say how wrong I was.  This LG 32LD350 32-Inch 720p 60 Hz LCD HDTV has an amazing picture quality and features you rarely get at a budget price, such as the sound equalization,so that the add's are not considerably louder than the program and the overall ease to set it up right out of the box.Having searched the web, I bought mine through Amazon, simply because they had the best price and I can always rely on their prompt delivery.  In my opinion, It's doubtful that there is a better 32" TV, or even one that comes close to the LG 32LD350 for all round value and quality without breaking the bank.  I would highly recommend it with confidence.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and super price
Reviews.Author: bullie76
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with my new LG LCD TV. Easy to set up and truly has a great picture. I bought it for my small den/office and it is just the right size. Would be a good one for my bedroom too. Pretty good sound, but not home stereo quality. But didn't expect that from a 32" model at this price either.Overall, very satisfied buyer.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV, Worth the price
Reviews.Author: jimnrb
Reviews.Content: After shopping around for 2 weeks I decided on the LG. In those 2 weeks the price actually dropped $25 which was even better. Ordered it on a Tuesday with free shipping which stated 3-5 days. TV was on doorstep 44 hours later. I have a Sony Bravia XB5 in living room and I must say I'm just as impressed with this TV as I am with the Sony. Picture is spectacular, sound in superb for a 32 inch. Great job Amazon!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Value
